required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anti-caries Potential of a Sodium Monofluorophosphate and Calcium Sodium Phosphosilicate Dentifrice
clinical_study.official_title: In Situ Study to Confirm the Anti-caries Potential of a 1.1365% w/w Sodium Monofluorophosphate (1500ppm F) Dentifrice

brief_summary.textblock: In situ study to compare treatment effect on enamel remineralization potential, measured by surface microhardness recovery (SMHR) and Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU). The study will explore the efficacy of an experimental sodium monofluorophosphate (SMFP) dentifrice containing calcium sodium phosphosilicate (CSP) in comparison to an experimental SMFP only dentifrice.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage (%) Change in Surface Microhardness (SMH) Following 21 Days of Twice Daily Treatment With the 1500 Ppm Fluoride + 5% CSP Dentifrice and With the 1500 Ppm Fluoride Dentifrice.
primary_outcome.description: Percent SMH recovery (SMHR) was calculated from hardness values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100. A greater percentage change in SMHR represents a better remineralisation and hence a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage (%) Change in SMH Following 21 Days of Twice Daily Treatment With 500 Ppm Fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP Dentifrice, 0 Ppm Fluoride and 0% CSP, and 0 Ppm Fluoride and 5 % CSP.
secondary_outcome.description: Percent SMH recovery (SMHR) was calculated from hardness values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100. A greater percentage change in SMHR represents a better remineralisation and hence a better outcome.
Change to EFU was determine using a microdrill enamel biopsy of the in situ enamel specimens.

arm_group.description: Dentifrice containing high fluoride content as SMFP and CSP
Dentifrice containing high fluoride content as SMFP and no CSP
Dentifrice containing low fluoride content as SMFP and no CSP
Dentifrice containing CSP but no fluoride
Dentifrice containing no CSP and no fluoride

intervention.description: CSP high percentage weight by weight
500 to 1500 parts per million (ppm) of fluoride

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Wears a removable bilateral mandibular partial denture that has good stability and support, with sufficient room on each side in the posterior buccal flange area to accommodate two enamel specimens [required dimensions 12 x 7 millimeters (mm)].

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited at one clinical site (US).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 95 participants were screened, of which 79 were randomized. Of the subjects who were not randomized, 11 did not meet the study criteria; 3 had protocol violations; 2 withdrew consent.

group.title: Overall Participants
group.description: In this cross-over study, participant partial dentures were modified to hold two enamel specimens. Denture was modified at the start of the first treatment period to hold the enamel specimens. The participants were randomized using a computer generated program to receive following dentifrices: Dentifrice containing 1500 parts per million (ppm) as sodium monofluorophosphate (SMFP) + 5% calcium sodium phosphosilicate (CSP) Dentifrice containing 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP + 0% CSP Dentifrice containing 500 ppm fluoride as SMFP + 0% CSP Dentifrice containing 0 ppm fluoride + 0% CSP Dentifrice containing 0 ppm fluoride + 5% CSP. The participants applied the given dentifrice as per their treatment group to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute. There was a washout period of 6 days between each treatment period.

participants_list.participants: Discontinuations: 1 due to other reason in P2 and 1 protocol violation in P4
Discontinuations:2 withdrawal of consent in period (P) 1; 1 AE in P2;1 protocol violation in P3 & P4
Discontinuations: 1 protocol violation in P1 and P2 each and 1 withdrawal of consent in P1.
Discontinuation: 1 in P4 due to other reasons
Discontinuations: 1 protocol violation in P1 and 1 withdrawal of consent and AE in P3

group.title: All Randomized Participants
group.description: All randomized participants were evaluated for baseline characteristics.

outcome.title: Percentage (%) Change in SMH Following 21 Days of Twice Daily Treatment With 500 Ppm Fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP Dentifrice, 0 Ppm Fluoride and 0% CSP, and 0 Ppm Fluoride and 5 % CSP.
outcome.description: Percent SMH recovery (SMHR) was calculated from hardness values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100. A greater percentage change in SMHR represents a better remineralisation and hence a better outcome.
outcome.population: PP population:all randomized participants in the ITT population who had no protocol violations leading to exclusion of all efficacy data from analyses.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 500 Ppm Fluoride as SMFP + 0% CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 0 Ppm Fluoride + 0% CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 0 ppm fluoride and 0 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 0 Ppm Fluoride + 5% CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 0 ppm fluoride and 5 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

measure.title: Percentage (%) Change in SMH Following 21 Days of Twice Daily Treatment With 500 Ppm Fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP Dentifrice, 0 Ppm Fluoride and 0% CSP, and 0 Ppm Fluoride and 5 % CSP.
measure.description: Percent SMH recovery (SMHR) was calculated from hardness values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100. A greater percentage change in SMHR represents a better remineralisation and hence a better outcome.
measure.population: PP population:all randomized participants in the ITT population who had no protocol violations leading to exclusion of all efficacy data from analyses.

outcome.title: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU)
outcome.description: Change to EFU was determine using a microdrill enamel biopsy of the in situ enamel specimens.
outcome.population: PP population: all randomized participants in the ITT population who had no protocol violations leading to exclusion of all efficacy data from analyses. Missing data was not imputed. Due to drop out there were differences in the number of participants analyzed per treatment group.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 1500 Ppm Fluoride as SMFP + 5% CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 5 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 0 Ppm Fluoride + 0% CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing no fluoride and no CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 0 Ppm Fluoride + 5% CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing no fluoride and 5 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

measure.title: Enamel Fluoride Uptake (EFU)
measure.description: Change to EFU was determine using a microdrill enamel biopsy of the in situ enamel specimens.
measure.population: PP population: all randomized participants in the ITT population who had no protocol violations leading to exclusion of all efficacy data from analyses. Missing data was not imputed. Due to drop out there were differences in the number of participants analyzed per treatment group.

outcome.title: Percentage (%) Change in Surface Microhardness (SMH) Following 21 Days of Twice Daily Treatment With the 1500 Ppm Fluoride + 5% CSP Dentifrice and With the 1500 Ppm Fluoride Dentifrice.
outcome.description: Percent SMH recovery (SMHR) was calculated from hardness values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100. A greater percentage change in SMHR represents a better remineralisation and hence a better outcome.
outcome.population: Per protocol (PP) population: The per protocol (PP) population was defined as those subjects in the intention to treat population who did not have protocol violations leading to exclusion of all efficacy data from analyses. Missing data was not imputed.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 1500ppm Fluoride as SMFP + 0% CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

group.title: Dentifrice Containing 1500ppm Fluoride as SMFP + 5 % CSP
group.description: Participants applied a full ribbon of the dentifrice (approximately 1.5 g) containing 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 5 % CSP, to a toothbrush and brushed their natural teeth twice daily for one timed minute.

measure.title: Percentage (%) Change in Surface Microhardness (SMH) Following 21 Days of Twice Daily Treatment With the 1500 Ppm Fluoride + 5% CSP Dentifrice and With the 1500 Ppm Fluoride Dentifrice.
measure.description: Percent SMH recovery (SMHR) was calculated from hardness values of enamel specimens at baseline (B), after in-situ hardening (R) and after first demineralization challenge (D1) using formula: [(D1-R)/ (D1-B)]*100. A greater percentage change in SMHR represents a better remineralisation and hence a better outcome.
measure.population: Per protocol (PP) population: The per protocol (PP) population was defined as those subjects in the intention to treat population who did not have protocol violations leading to exclusion of all efficacy data from analyses. Missing data was not imputed.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis states that the population mean for the 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP + 0% CSP minus the population mean for the 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 5% CSP dentifrice is more than 6 %.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The success criterion for this study was to observe the upper bound of the 2-sided 95% confidence interval for difference in % change in SMHR to be <= 6 units SMHR i.e. 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP + 5% CSP is no more than 6 units inferior to the 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP + 0 % CSP dentifrice.
analysis.method_desc: Based on the mixed effects ANOVA considering treatment and study period as factors, and subject as random effect
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference is 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP minus 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 5 % CSP such that a positive difference favors 1500 ppm fluoride as SMFP and 0 % CSP

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from the start of the investigational product (or washout product), and until 5 days following last administration of the investigational product.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Invasive lobular carcinoma of left breast

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
